file_content.text: They want that vein, they're going to have to fight for it.
Good news, good news. The non-coms'll be able to start mining as soon as we've secured the ruins.
Best hurry. The Republic collapses those tunnels, and it'll be months before that vein is accessible again.
The battle for this ruin is my purview.
If you're heading out there, my lord, I'd like to beg a favor.
Could use an infiltration specialist right now, if you're heading into my sector.
If you're going to be wandering around my battlefield, I'd appreciate you contributing to the fight.
My troops have the stand-up fighting under control, but I've concerns about collateral damage.
Explain.
Why worry about old ruins?
These ruins have no strategic value, what's important is the record-setting crystal mass underneath.
I haven't got all day. Talk.
We're sitting on top of the largest deposit of crystal yet discovered.
Republic knows they can't hold it, so they're going to collapse tunnels to keep us from tapping the crystal vein. That can't happen.
Agreed.
I'm glad you agree. I'm certain we can run the Republic off, but I can't be sure we could prevent them from sabotage.
How do we stop them?
You're certain of this threat?
Forward observers have spotted heavy excavation equipment in operation, and they're in no position to be mining right now.
The boys whipped up some baradium charges that'll blast the Republic's heavy equipment to dust, just need volunteers to sneak them into the dig site.
Consider it done.
I don't volunteer, I work.
If that's what it takes, I'll request the hazard pay.
Check back once that heavy equipment is destroyed... and careful with those charges, they're touchy.
Maybe later. [Refuse quest]
We'll try our best in the meantime.
Planning an unpleasant surprise for the Republic, any moment now.
